alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 11:29AM CDT until May 16 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Matagorda and Wharton Counties. For the Tres Palacios River...including Midfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tres Palacios River near Midfield. * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water spills into the flood plain on the right upstream bank and covers the meander point at the meander curve. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 24.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.0 feet on 05/20/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Tres Palacios River Midfield 24.0 22.0 Sun 10 am CD 24.0 15.8 7.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM CDT.
